title: Source: Fins 1st, Steelers worst in NFLPA survey
content: For the third consecutive year, the Dolphins ranked first in the NFL Players Association annual report cards, according to survey results obtained by ESPN. The Steelers finished last.

title: Sens' Tkachuk miffed over White House AI video
content: Brady Tkachuk said he didn't appreciate the AI-doctored video released by the White House that made it appear he was disparaging Canadians.

title: Chris Bosh: 'Lucky to be alive' after health scare
content: Chris Bosh said that he's "lucky to be alive" after a recent health scare that resulted in him waking up "covered in my own blood."

title: SGA cleared to return for short-handed Thunder
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, who missed the Thunder's past nine games because of an abdominal strain, will be available Friday against the Nuggets.

title: Sources: Johnson to Titans in latest Jets trade
content: The Jets are trading pass rusher Jermaine Johnson to the Titans for defensive tackle T'Vondre Sweat, sources told ESPN.

content: The Colts have given quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. permission to seek a trade, his agent told ESPN.

title: NCAA eyes big penalties for FB transfer offenses
content: The NCAA's football oversight committee is proposing stiff penalties for schools and coaches who violate the rules of the transfer portal window.

content: Oregon State men's basketball coach Wayne Tinkle will not return next season after 12 years at the helm, the school announced Thursday.

content: We're handing out report cards on big offseason moves, starting with the Jermaine Johnson-T'Vondre Sweat trade.

title: Max Scherzer's re-signing with Blue Jays fulfills wish from daughter's letter to the club
content: On Wednesday, a source confirmed to ESPN's Alden Gonzalez that Scherzer and the Blue Jays had reached an agreement to keep the 41-year-old three-time Cy Young winner in Toronto.

content: Amid cartel-related violence in Mexico, soccer leagues suspended games. Will the situation affect the country's status as a host for the World Cup?

title: New Los Angeles Kings winger Artemi Panarin gifts mascot Rolex for No. 72 jersey
content: Panarin wanted to wear the No. 72 upon being traded to Los Angeles. The only problem is the Kings' mascot already wore that number.

title: It's been three years since Premier League issued against Man City. What's going on?
content: The Premier League announced it was charging Man City for breaching the rules in February 2023. City have denied the charges, and the hearings ended in December 2024. What is taking so long?

title: Cleveland Heights to honor Olympic gold medalist Laila Edwards
content: Cleveland Heights plans to honor Edwards, the first Black woman to play for the U.S. women's national team.

content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest pound-for-pound rankings.

content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: AI use in warfare: Anthropic rejects US demand for ‚Äòunrestricted‚Äô military access
content: AI firm Anthropic is refusing Pentagon demands for unrestricted use of its technology, citing concerns over mass surveillance and autonomous weapons. This public dispute could lead to the company losing its government contract as early as Friday, despite Anthropic's willingness to negotiate.

title: 'Our video analyst prepared a slide': Suryakumar Yadav reveals secret behind India's win
content: India kept their T20 World Cup semifinal hopes alive with a dominant 72-run victory over Zimbabwe. A powerful batting display, featuring Abhishek Sharma's 55 and Hardik Pandya's unbeaten 50, set a massive target. Arshdeep Singh's three wickets then stifled Zimbabwe's chase, despite a brilliant 97 from Brian Bennett. This win sets up a crucial decider against the West Indies.

title: Cognizant AI chief‚Äôs one-word take on Claude-triggered market wipeout
content: Cognizant's chief AI officer dismisses fears of AI disrupting IT services, stating enterprises still need significant support for deployment and integration.  Despite AI advancements, companies require human expertise to map AI agents effectively. This demand is fueling growth for services firms, with rivals like TCS and Wipro echoing similar sentiments, even as some job cuts emerge.

title: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's wedding photos leave fans in awe
content: Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's intimate Udaipur wedding has captivated fans, with photos drawing striking comparisons to mythological epics. A viral image of the couple, their shawl still connected as they hold hands, has sparked comparisons to divine pairings like Shiv-Parvati, Arjuna-Subhadra, and Ram-Sita, highlighting their regal and devoted presence.

title: Strike-rate problem? Not anymore. India smash Zimbabwe, shatter records
content: India unleashed a record-breaking batting blitz against Zimbabwe, scoring 256/4 with a remarkable 17 sixes. Six batters achieved strike rates over 150, showcasing exceptional collective intent. This dominant performance, marked by minimal dot balls and a powerful finish, reignited India's attacking spirit and kept their semifinal hopes soaring.

title: 'Open war': Pakistan's Khwaja Asif warns as border clashes with Afghanistan resume
content: Pakistan has declared "open war" on the Afghan Taliban government following intense border clashes.  Islamabad launched air strikes on key Afghan cities, including Kabul and Kandahar, after Afghan forces attacked Pakistani troops. The Taliban responded with retaliatory operations, confirming air strikes but denying casualties.  Both sides reported dozens of casualties amidst escalating tensions.

title: Anthropic Claude Code's security flaws expose devices to silent hacking, claims report
content: Security experts have identified three critical vulnerabilities in Anthropic's Claude Code, potentially allowing remote code execution and API key theft. Attackers could exploit malicious configurations in public repositories, compromising developers' machines. Anthropic has issued fixes, but the incident highlights supply chain risks as AI tools integrate into development workflows.

title: This mechanical engineer chose to become a househusband, and why every man should read his story
content: Amit Kumar Dubey, a proud house husband from Bihar, has redefined traditional gender roles by dedicating himself to full-time household management. He gave up his job to support his wife, handling cooking, cleaning, and childcare. Despite occasional worries about his responsibilities as the eldest son, Amit finds fulfillment in his role, supported by his wife and family.

title: ED to court: Got sanction to prosecute Chidambaram
content: The Enforcement Directorate has secured clearance from the home ministry to prosecute former finance minister P. Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis and INX Media money laundering cases. These proceedings, pending for nearly 15 years due to multiple legal challenges, center on ED‚Äôs claims of irregular FIPB approvals and alleged receipt of illicit payments.

title: Inside Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda‚Äôs wedding album
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda‚Äôs wedding photos are finally here, and they do far more than capture a ceremony. The images tell a story ‚Äî one of friendship, faith, tradition and a love that feels deeply rooted and unfiltered.

title: Kayla Nicole opens up on life with Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are just days away from stepping into the most exciting and happy phases of their lives. Amid all the wedding preparations, Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, has made many controversial digs at the high profile couple. Now, her cryptic confession about Travis Kelce and what it was like dating him has resurfaced and sparked panic.

title: AJ Styles & Wendy Jones combined net worth 2026, retirement and legacy
content: Wrestling icon AJ Styles has officially hung up his boots in February 2026, retiring after a career-ending match and soon after, earning a WWE Hall of Fame induction. He and wife Wendy Jones, married since 2000, are now prioritizing family life in Georgia.

title: Megyn Kelly responds to rumor over Candace Owens‚Äô Bride of Charlie series
content: Megyn Kelly strongly denied rumors that she helped Candace Owens produce the Bride of Charlie series about Erika Kirk. After an X user claimed she screened the series and offered legal advice, Kelly responded, calling the allegation false and the poster a ‚Äúfilthy liar.‚Äù She also previously said she has criticized Owens many times and does not comment on every controversy.

title: 'Do it the Auqib Nabi way': Ex-India batter's message to young cricketers goes viral
content: Former India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik lauded Jammu and Kashmir pacer Auqib Nabi for his exceptional Ranji Trophy season, calling his performance a benchmark for aspiring cricketers. Karthik highlighted Nabi's consistent dominance, endurance, and resilience, stating he single-handedly propelled his team. Nabi's stellar bowling has been instrumental in Jammu and Kashmir's strong showing in the tournament.

title: IYC protest: Himachal Pradesh-Delhi Police standoff drags on till dawn
content: A dramatic police standoff unfolded between Delhi and Himachal Pradesh forces over the arrest of three Youth Congress workers following a protest. The Delhi-Haryana team faced multiple roadblocks in Shimla, delaying the handover of the accused for 24 hours. A political spat erupted, with the BJP accusing the state government of misusing police power.

title: '15 outposts captured, 40 Pak soldiers killed': Afghan Taliban launches big offensive
content: Afghanistan's military has retaliated with strikes against Pakistan following recent Pakistani airstrikes on Afghan soil, which Kabul claims killed dozens of civilians. Pakistan stated its operations targeted militant groups responsible for recent attacks within its borders. This escalation highlights deepening tensions between the two neighboring nations.

title: PLA in peril: Xi's purge cripples China's military; is Beijing vulnerable?
content: China's military purges are creating significant gaps in its command structure. This is impacting the readiness of the People's Liberation Army. The International Institute for Strategic Studies reports these issues.  The purges are expected to continue.  China's military spending is also rising in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Rashee Rice lawsuit adds heat after NFL suspension decision
content: Rashee Rice is entering the final year of his rookie deal with the Kansas City Chiefs while facing a new civil lawsuit in Texas. The allegations come after his 2024 high-speed crash and six-game NFL suspension. With past discipline already on record and more scrutiny ahead, his long-term future in Kansas City is now uncertain.

title: Are Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce planning to compete in the 2030 Winter Olympics?
content: Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce joked on their New Heights podcast about competing in the 2030 Winter Olympics after being inspired by Team USA in 2026. Travis wants to try double luge, while Jason prefers skeleton. Jason Kelce said, ‚ÄúI am not a luger,‚Äù making it clear the idea is fun for now, not official.

title: Candace Owens challenges Erika Kirk‚Äôs single mom claim
content: Candace Owens released the first episode of her series Bride of Charlie, where she accused Erika Kirk of misrepresenting her childhood. Owens claimed Erika was not raised solely by her mother, Lori Frantzve, and said her father and stepfather were present. Owens also said Lori ‚Äúmarried four times.‚Äù Erika Kirk has not responded.

title: India batting comes back to life, keeps T20 World Cup campaign alive
content: From the strong powerplay to intent in the middle overs and a blockbuster finish‚Äîback-to-back sixes by Hardik Pandya‚ÄîIndia checked the boxes they were yearning to in the fixtures preceding Thursday's clash. Restoring the right-left combination at the top of the order worked wonders for the defending champions.

title: 15-year-old forced to drink, gang-raped in car; 2 held in Haldwani
content: Two taxi drivers lured a 15-year-old student away on the pretext of visiting a tourist spot in Haldwani. They allegedly forced her to consume alcohol and raped her in their car at a secluded location. The accused, aged 20 and 24, were arrested after the survivor's family filed a complaint.

title: New challenge: ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô gets a pushback from US, China
content: Central to the disputes is India‚Äôs production-linked incentive programme, launched by the Modi government in 2020 with the aim of strengthening domestic manufacturing.

title: OPS likely to join DMK today ‚Äòto take on Palaniswami‚Äô
content: OPS, who has been fighting long ‚Äî and so far unsuccessful ‚Äî battles in courts and before Election Commission of India (ECI) to return to, if not regain control of AIADMK, is expected to join the rival party in the presence of chief minister and DMK president M K Stalin at Anna Arivalayam, the DMK headquarters.

title: When tradition becomes torture: Inside Bihar‚Äôs pakadua vivah cases
content: Bihar witnesses a disturbing rise in 'pakadua vivah,' where men and boys are forced into marriage. Recent cases across districts like Samastipur and Patna involve students, teachers, and even minors abducted and wedded under duress. Viral social media videos expose these incidents, prompting urgent calls for stricter laws and swifter police action against perpetrators.

title: What this teenager suffering from autism does with his money is so heartwarming
content: A 16-year-old reportedly autistic boy, Pratap Joshi, sells toys outside a mall in Dehradun to support his family, earning ‚Çπ500 daily. His situation highlights systemic gaps in support for families facing disability and financial crisis, sparking concern and calls for structured help and fundraising.

title: 7-yr-old lowered into well to rescue baby goat in Bihar's English village
content: A seven-year-old boy in Bihar displayed remarkable bravery, descending into a deep well to rescue a baby goat. Locals lowered him with a rope, and he successfully brought the animal back up. While the act of compassion was cheered, authorities are now investigating the risky rescue, emphasizing the need to protect children.

title: Horoscope Today: Daily astrological predictions for February 27
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 27, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

content: The audit report noted that the Mines and Geology Department has failed to provide details on these dues for more than five years

Subbarayudu Tirupati Airport Director Bhuminathan and others inspected the site being readied for the ‚ÄòBhumi Puja‚Äô.

content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) called the community ‚Äúvibrant‚Äù and said, ‚ÄúTheir enduring bond with India, traditions carried across generations and remarkable contributions to Israel serve as a living bridge between our countries.‚Äù

title: Railway Minister announces portal to attract innovative tech solutions
content: The policy proposes a dedicated innovation portal to enable open submissions of detailed proposals, and provides financial support of up to 50% of the development cost for selected solutions

title: From the ashes, emerges a green idea at Brahmapuram
content: The first Compressed Biogas plant in the State, which converts biodegradable waste into biogas, has become operational at the Brahmapuram garbage treatment yard of the Kochi Corporation. M.P. Praveen meets the engineers and managers of the plant set up by the BPCL Kochi Refinery at the plant site to learn about the facility, which is expected to solve the issue of waste management in the city

title: Stand-off between Delhi and H.P. police forces triggers political row in hill State
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu termed Delhi Police‚Äôs action ‚Äòan attempt to undermine the sovereignty of the State‚Äô

content: Questions raised over whether the Bill meaningfully advances the right to health or dilutes the State‚Äôs responsibility as the primary provider of care

content: Bench says prisons are institutions of correction, where dignity, self-respect and social reintegration are not aspirational ideals but constitutional necessities

content: Praful Patel re-elected as national working president, Sunil Tatkare as State chief; Ajit Pawar‚Äôs son Parth to become Rajya Sabha MP

content: The decades-old Maharashtra‚ÄìKarnataka border dispute was once again raised in the Maharashtra Assembly, with Governor Acharya Devvrat reiterating the government‚Äôs commitment to resolve the issue.

title: Chief of panel probing Manipur violence quits, ex-Supreme Court judge to take over
content: Since its formation on June 4, 2023, the commission was given four extensions, the latest on December 16 last year; it has received around 11,000 affidavits

title: Vizag to roll out AI driven traffic management systems
content: Vizagites could see artificial intelligence-driven surveillance with over 2,000 high-end cameras visible at 56 corridors (like RK Beach Road) across 102 junctions in the city under this Rs 60-65 crore worth project.

title: Karnataka High Court allows mother‚Äôs plea to change minor daughter‚Äôs surname to reflect maternal lineage in birth certificate
content: The presumption that a child must invariably bear the surname of the father is not a constitutional mandate but a social convention, the court said

title: Supreme Court asks CBI, probe agencies to share charge sheet copies with Manipur violence victims, families
content: A three-judge Bench headed by CJI Surya Kant issued the directions after going through the 12th status report submitted by former Maharashtra DGP Dattatray Padsalgikar

title: ED places before court prosecution sanction orders against P. Chidambaram in two cases
content: The agency aims to expedite the trial, alleging that those linked to Karti P. Chidambaram received illegal gratification for approving FIPB for INX Media and FDI for the Aircel-Maxis deal while P. Chidambaram was Finance Minister

title: Global order in peril from lack of cooperation, says Merkel; slams China, U.S. for resisting AI regulation
content: Former German Chancellor delivers first Manmohan Singh lecture, praises former PM for economic reforms; says governments must hold big tech firms, social media platforms, AI developers to account

title: Revisiting the timeless allure of classic cars at Udaipur‚Äôs Oberoi Concours d‚ÄôElegance 2026
content: The second edition of the Oberoi Concours d‚ÄôElegance in Udaipur saw 120 classic cars and bikes, celebrating automotive heritage. What came through at the event besides culture, currency, and caviar, was the emotion associated with the vehicles

title: Why bulldozers threaten due process
content: The Allahabad High Court examines whether demolitions carried out immediately after FIRs violate constitutional principles, stressing that punishment lies exclusively with the judiciary; it warns that such selective demolitions, carried out without notice or hearing, undermine due process, erode constitutional rights

title: Aravalli row: Supreme Court asks Environment Ministry, others to suggest names of domain experts for panel
content: The panel will define the Aravalli hills and ranges. The court observes that only lawful mining would be allowed in the region and extends the stay order on the uniform definition of these hills

title: CJI vows reforms in working of Supreme Court Registry
content: Decision comes after Chief Justice found that similar cases are being listed for hearing before different Benches of the top court

title: Fitness of old private buildings remains unchecked in Kozhikode
content: Though structural safety audits of old public buildings happen at regular intervals under the supervision of qualified engineers, such an inspection is hardly conducted to check the condition of many old facilities in the private sector

title: BJD seeks Odisha Minister‚Äôs resignation after farmer dies while waiting at procurement centre
content: While the BJP Government had promised to procure all the paddy, only about 63 lakh metric tonnes, approximately 33% of the total production, have been procured in Odisha so far

title: Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay‚Äôs descendant joins BJP ahead of Bengal poll
content: In September 2025, Sumitra Chattopadhyay and her relative Sajal Chattopadhyay joined Bengal BJP president Samik Bhattacharya to address the neglect of the ancestral home of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay

title: CM orders strict water safety monitoring across urban local bodies
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Department, Public Health Engineering, Health Department and district administrations have been instructed to work in close coordination and intensify field inspections

title: North Paravur municipality plans heritage township project
content: This was announced in the annual Budget presented by municipal vice-chairperson Laiji Biju. The Budget envisages a revenue of ‚Çπ60,0316,471 and an expenditure of ‚Çπ56,1281,040

title: Pinarayi Vijayan sheds light on little-known aspects of his life in a free-wheeling interview with actor Mohanlal
content: The Chief Minister reveals his love for Rajanikanth movies and his preference for action flicks. He also dwells on how reading had helped him shrug off his childhood fear of ‚Äúghosts and demons‚Äù¬†

title: T.K. Oommen, a leading architect of modern Indian sociology, passes away
content: A highly-respected scholar, teacher and author, Prof. Oommen is known for his writings and approaches to social justice, identity and pluralism; he had gained wide attention for his study of the Bhoodan Movement

title: GBA chief‚Äôs public meeting draws huge crowd; citizens welcome the initiative
content: Residents have raised concerns over issues, including fallen leaves on pedestrian pathways, illegal dumping of waste, building violations, haphazard parking and footpath encroachments

content: Declaring that ‚Äúheads must roll‚Äù, CJI Surya Kant orders ‚Äúblanket and complete ban‚Äù on the Class 8 social science textbook; initiates contempt action, issues show cause to NCERT director, School Education Secretary

title: Close down Panka mosque, say leaders during Bagalkot Chalo
content: They say that the mosque has been a point of contention for several decades and it has led to several law and order disturbances

title: Two Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter
content: The slain Maoists have been preliminarily identified as Hichami Madda and Manki Podium and they were carrying a reward of ‚Çπ5 lakh each, say police

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha to meet CMs, Opposition leaders against U.S. deal in fight for federal rights
content: SKM leaders say they will submit a memorandum to the Chief Ministers and Leaders of Opposition for protecting interest of farmers by holding special sessions of State Assemblies and adopting resolutions asking the Union government to refrain from signing the deal

title:
A.P. Assembly approves amendments 
to Assigned Lands, GSWS Bills
content: Decks cleared for the government to acquire assigned lands on long-term lease to set up renewable energy projects under A.P. Integrated Clean Energy Policy 2024

title: Zero compensation drive to clear all wildlife conflict claims by March 31: Minister A.K. Saseendran
content: All eligible applications for compensations and relief assistance will be cleared within the deadline, says Minister.

title: 2,077 title deeds distributed in Idukki
content: While inaugurating a district-level title deed fest at Cheruthoni Panchayat Hall on Thursday, Minister says that given Idukki‚Äôs complex land issues, legal acquisition procedures are being fast-tracked

title: Govt. urged to order comprehensive probe into building collapse in Kozhikode
content: Kozhikode Corporation Council demands ‚Çπ25-lakh compensation each for the families of the deceased and seeks government jobs for their dependents

title: International conference in Magnetic Resonance Imaging in medicine
content: Three-day event will bring together clinicians, scientists, and industry experts to explore the latest breakthroughs in Magnetic Resonance Imaging and data processing

title: Columbia Student Detained By US Immigration Agents Released After Mamdani Meets Trump
content: Ellie Aghayeva, a senior from Azerbaijan studying neuroscience and politics, hasn't been publicly linked to any of the pro-Palestinian demonstrations that roiled Columbia's campus.

title: Pak Declares "Open War", Bombs Kabul, Kandahar After Afghanistan Attack
content: Islamabad has declared "open war" on the Afghan Taliban government following renewed clashes along the shared border between Afghanistan and Pakistan.

title: How Google Exposed Chinese Spy Network That Targeted Victims In 42 Countries
content: Google prevented a Chinese-linked hacking group attempting to infiltrate telecom and government organisations across at least 42 countries, the tech giant claimed Wednesday.

title: "Intelligence Tools Have Changed": Jack Dorsey's Block Cuts Over 4,000 Jobs Amid AI Boom
content: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey said they opted for a single deep round of cuts instead of multiple smaller layoffs over time.

title: "Cannot In Good Conscience": Anthropic Rejects Pentagon's Demands
content: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth gave Anthropic until Friday to agree to unconditional military use of its technology or face being forced to comply under emergency federal powers.

title: After NCERT Row, Information Ministry Asked To Stop Circulation Of Book
content: The Union Ministry of Education wrote to the ministries of information and broadcasting, and electronics, asking them to stop the dissemination of a controversial NCERT textbook through digital platforms and electronic media, officials said.

title: Afghanistan Attacks Border Posts, Claims Dozens Killed, Pakistan Hits Back
content: Afghanistan attacked Pakistani forces on Thursday and claimed to have killed and captured dozens of soldiers in retaliation for deadly air strikes days earlier.

title: 'Thankful To Media For Bringing Issue Into Public': Top Court On NCERT Row
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday thanked the media for bringing to the fore the issue concerning NCERT's Class 8 social science book containing "offending" contents on corruption in the judiciary.

title: Police, Students Injured In Clash During JNU Protest March, Several Detained
content: Police and JNU students were injured after they clashed during a march by the students' union here on Thursday, with police claiming that they were assaulted by the protestors.

title: Inside Iran's Missile Power: Why It Alarms West And How Far They Can Reach
content: Iran holds a new round of nuclear talks with the United States on Thursday in Geneva. Its arsenal of missiles has been a sticking point in negotiations.

title: PM Modi Israel Visit Highlights: 'Confident Ties Will Reach New Heights': PM Modi As He Leaves Israel
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit Highlights: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: India-Israel Ties Elevated To "Special Strategic Partnership" During PM's Visit
content: India and Israel on Thursday announced the elevation of their bilateral relationship to a "Special Strategic Partnership for Peace, Innovation and Prosperity", marking a significant expansion of cooperation across defence, technology and trade.

title: Instagram To Alert Parents When Teens Search For Suicide Terms
content: Instagram will begin notifying parents when their teenage children repeatedly search for content related to suicide or self-harm, platform owner Meta announced Thursday, as the company faces mounting legal pressure over its handling of young users.

title: White House Accused Of Hiding Trump Allegations In Epstein Files
content: The top Democrat on a congressional committee probing the Jeffrey Epstein scandal accused the White House Thursday of covering up revelations about President Donald Trump in files on the late sex offender.

title: Tigers Changing Stripes, Preying More Actively On Humans: Study
content: The growing number of tigers and humans has enhanced the man-animal conflict, leading to more instances of tiger attack.

title: China Sacks Minister, 9 Military Officials As Part Of Xi's Corruption Purge
content: They also voted to remove Liu Shaoyun from his position as head of the People's Liberation Army's military court, without explaining why.

title: In Historic First, US Deploys Stealth Fighters In Israel Amid Iran Tensions
content: The US has already gathered a fleet of aircraft and warships in the Middle East as a war looms over Iran. However, for the first time, the US has deployed combat aircraft to Israel for a potential war mission.

title: 'Heinous Individual, Didn't Know About Criminal Acts': Hillary Clinton On Epstein
content: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton told US House lawmakers that she did not know of late paedophile Jeffrey Epstein or his ex-associate Ghislaine Maxwell's crimes on the first day of depositions that will also include Bill Clinton.

title: Rs 35,000 A Day For Cheetah Meals? Political Storm Over Kuno Park Spending
content: Crores of rupees are being spent on feeding cheetahs at Kuno National Park, with the Madhya Pradesh government revealing in the Assembly that nearly Rs 35,000 is being spent every single day on goat meat for the big cats.

title: Afghanistan Retaliates, Launches "Large-Scale Offensive Ops" Against Pak
content: Afghanistan has launched offensive operations against Pakistani military positions along the border, the Taliban's spokesperson said on Thursday, in retaliation for recent Pakistani airstrikes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea confident of landing Aston Villa's Rogers
content: Chelsea remain keen on aston villa midfielder Morgan Rogers . real madrid have their eye on arsenal's Gabriel Magalhes, according to teamTalk . the 23-year-old will likely have to be over the ¬£100 million villa received from Manchester City in 2021 .

title: Champions League talking points: Madrid, PSG or Italian football -- who is worse off?
content: seventeen goals and three red cards in four games capped chaotic night . a 5-2 aggregate win over internazionale and 5-2 win over england . manchester united and chelsea both made light work of club brugge and FK Qarabag .

title: Prospects to watch: From the high school son of a former MLB All-Star to the next Mets aceÔªø
content: the 2026 World Baseball Classic offers a unique opportunity to get a glimpse at some of baseball's stars of tomorrow . one of the most intriguing is Joseph Contreras, a prep right-hander in Georgia and the son of former big league righty . he is best known for his time with the New York Yankees and Chicago White Sox .

title: Way-too-early roster predictions for the 2026 MLB All-Star Game
content: it's time for our annual way-too-early All-Star selections . we predict who will make the trip to Philadelphia for the 2026 Midsummer Classic in 138 days . 34 players have hit at least 50 home runs in a season, with 23 doing it just once .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: 'There's not one path': The unexpected rise of Keaton Wagler at Illinois
content: a hint of exasperation in underwood's voice as he ran through the well-worn tropes about Keaton Wagler . the coach is sensitive to minimizing Wagler's journey, or separating him from the group of freshmen who have taken over the men's college basketball season . underwood: "if the story is that everybody missed on him, we didn't"

title: NFLPA 2026 report cards: See the results for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Great powers, fractured rules: Is the era of US-led world order over?
content: world leaders dropped the usual diplomatic language at the Munich Security Conference . france warned that the global order ‚Äúno longer exists‚Äù . the u.s. secretary of state Marco Rubio declared that ‚Äúthe old world is gone‚Äù at davos .

title: Drone-dropped arms cache seized near Bikaner; BSF, police recover 5 China-made pistols, 325 cartridges
content: the joint operation took place at Chak 24 KND in Gram Panchayat 14 BD . the consignment was found in eight packets during a BSF search in a farmer's field . security agencies seized "5 Made-in-China pistols and around 325 cartridges" from the spot .

title: India, Israel upgrade ties; PM backs Gaza peace plan
content: PM Narendra Modi and his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu welcomed the plan . they discussed the regional developments, including the peace process . modi and Netanyahu also spoke about the US-Iran tensions . he stressed India‚Äôs ‚Äúfirm belief‚Äù in dialogue and the significance of a peaceful solution .

title: Bubble Watch: Georgia, Texas fall short of big wins -- but hold steady
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . teams have roughly three weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on their potential .

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: more than 300 prospects will be in Indianapolis this week for the combine . only 32 of them will ultimately go in Round 1 of the 2026 NFL draft on April 23 . there hasn't been a ton of movement on the board yet .

title: Bangladesh tension leads to 9% fall in foreign tourist arrivals

Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage‚Äîboth reflective and news-driven‚Äîadds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact.
